title.narrative: Support for Strengthening and Expanding Comprehensive HIV and AIDS Prevention

description.narrative: In South Africa, the Support for Strengthening and Expanding Comprehensive HIV and AIDS Prevention project, a CDC-funded initiative reduces mother-to-child-transmission of HIV and HIV infection rates among youth aged 10-24. Pathfinder is the only CDC partner implementing this project whose focus is youth friendly service provision for young people coupled with strategies for primary and secondary prevention. Now entering its fourth year, the project has supported 17,120 individuals aged 10-24 to receive youth-friendly testing and counseling services for HIV at facilities and link them to proper and appropriate support and care; over 4,564 women aged 10-24 to attend their first ANC visit; and 763 HIV+ young people are provided with ongoing support for ART adherence.

participating-org.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
